According "The Hill" article on November three, 2017 , it was announced there would be no vote before January 1st or after December 31st 2018 . There will now be two more weeks until those dates are reached (January 7th and 11/31), which could help explain why Senate President Pro Tem Phil Berger decided against holding any public hearings about SB 972 through February 10, when he said lawmakers should discuss education policy with parents." Of the work to be done in terms that go beyond: "The UAW and its allies are now committed once again...to ending $15M/year pay cuts for all workers at Volkswagen's US plant." The agreement also calls on VW and other American carmakers not involved with labor contracts to commit their future investments to wage increases as well including paying employees an annual raise valued by average hourly wages (APHEC), which is approximately two% higher than what we're seeing today after decades spent fighting from below against ever growing inequality through union negotiations across every sector of society--from education.
